body:
I see there's issue #4013

Maybe it's working as intended but it's not working as it should in the real world.

Perhaps the issue should be named

"Provide URLEncode function"

What do you do when you have to output a filename as weird as this and put it into a `<a href=`?
If anyone copies that link, that unencoded link, and posts it somewhere and the input parser of that location where that link was posted doesn't see that a space in the URL doesn't mean that it's the end of the URL then the link will be a `http://domain.tld/files/10000`. And nice incoming backlink to a 404 location. And who has to fix it? Not the one who shared the link, me. I have to fix it, because there's not an URLencode function in Go.
